original_title: CC members who abstained from voting should resign: Mahindananda
original_body_lines: Parliament, March 20 (Daily Mirror)- The Constitutional Council members who abstained from voting when approving Deshabandu Tennakoon as IGP should resign immediately, government MP Mahindananda Aluthgamage told Parliament today.
"Those two members should not be in the Constitutional Council if they cannot come to a firm decision, MP Aluthgamage said.
"We request that the Constitutional Council be dissolved if its members continue to behave as they do now," he also said.
